0: Pain is temporary. Quitting lasts forever. — Lance Armstrong
1: The pain you feel today will be the strength you feel tomorrow. — Unknown
2: Success is to be measured not so much by the position that one has reached in life as by the obstacles which he has overcome. — Booker T. Washington
3: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body. — Seneca
4: Out of difficulties grow miracles. — Jean de La Bruyère
5: We must embrace pain and burn it as fuel for our journey. — Kenji Miyazawa
6: Turn your wounds into wisdom. — Oprah Winfrey
7: Without pain, without sacrifice, we would have nothing. — Fight Club
8: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it. — Molière
9: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny. — C.S. Lewis
10: Adversity causes some men to break; others to break records. — William Arthur Ward
11: The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive. — John Green
12: The struggle you're in today is developing the strength you need for tomorrow. — Robert Tew
13: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity. — Albert Einstein
14: Tough times never last, but tough people do. — Robert H. Schuller
15: Where there is no struggle, there is no strength. — Oprah Winfrey
16: Challenges are what make life interesting and overcoming them is what makes life meaningful. — Joshua J. Marine
17: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist. — Gail Sheehy
18: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials. — Seneca
19: The greater the difficulty, the more glory in surmounting it. — Epicurus
20: Pain is inevitable. Suffering is optional. — Haruki Murakami
21: Strength does not come from winning. Your struggles develop your strengths. When you go through hardships and decide not to surrender, that is strength. — Arnold Schwarzenegger
22: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall. — Nelson Mandela
23: It is not the mountain we conquer, but ourselves. — Sir Edmund Hillary
24: Every adversity, every failure, every heartache carries with it the seed of an equal or greater benefit. — Napoleon Hill
25: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts. — Winston Churchill
26: The harder the conflict, the greater the triumph. — George Washington
27: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us. — Ralph Waldo Emerson
28: Fall seven times, stand up eight. — Japanese Proverb
29: Life is very interesting. In the end, some of your greatest pains become your greatest strengths. — Drew Barrymore
30: Success is stumbling from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm. — Winston S. Churchill
31: It is hard to fail, but it is worse never to have tried to succeed. — Theodore Roosevelt
32: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life. — Muhammad Ali
33: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly. — Robert F. Kennedy
34: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today. — Franklin D. Roosevelt
35: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it. — Charles R. Swindoll
36: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack in will. — Vince Lombardi
37: What seems to us as bitter trials are often blessings in disguise. — Oscar Wilde
38: The greatest weapon against stress is our ability to choose one thought over another. — William James
39: The best way out is always through. — Robert Frost
40: You may encounter many defeats, but you must not be defeated. — Maya Angelou
41: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start. — Nido Qubein
42: Believe you can and you're halfway there. — Theodore Roosevelt
43: With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts. — Eleanor Roosevelt
44: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. — Sam Levenson
45: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you. — Walt Whitman
46: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. — Eleanor Roosevelt
47: The only way to do great work is to love what you do. — Steve Jobs
48: You can't cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water. — Rabindranath Tagore
49: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does. — William James
50: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals. — Zig Ziglar
51: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor. — Elon Musk
52: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great. — John D. Rockefeller
53: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have. — Thomas Jefferson
54: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful. — Albert Schweitzer
55: I attribute my success to this: I never gave or took any excuse. — Florence Nightingale
56: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. — Henry David Thoreau
57: If you are not willing to risk the usual, you will have to settle for the ordinary. — Jim Rohn
58: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing. — Walt Disney
59: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus. — Bruce Lee
60: The best revenge is massive success. — Frank Sinatra
61: Opportunities don't happen. You create them. — Chris Grosser
62: Don't be distracted by criticism. Remember—the only taste of success some people get is to take a bite out of you. — Zig Ziglar
63: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world. — Roy T. Bennett
64: Success seems to be connected with action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes but they don't quit. — Conrad Hilton
65: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it. — Oprah Winfrey
66: Don't aim for success if you want it; just do what you love and believe in, and it will come naturally. — David Frost
67: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it. — Maya Angelou
68: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary. — Vidal Sassoon
69: If you really look closely, most overnight successes took a long time. — Steve Jobs
70: The secret of success is to do the common thing uncommonly well. — John D. Rockefeller Jr.
71: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take. — Wayne Gretzky
72: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you're right. — Henry Ford
73: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear. — Rosa Parks
74: The question isn't who is going to let me; it's who is going to stop me. — Ayn Rand
75: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great. — John D. Rockefeller
76: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way. — Napoleon Hill
77: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along. — George Herbert
78: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above it. — Washington Irving
79: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today. — Franklin D. Roosevelt
80: Keep on going, and the chances are that you will stumble on something, perhaps when you are least expecting it. I never heard of anyone ever stumbling on something sitting down. — Charles F. Kettering
81: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th. — Julie Andrews
82: In order to succeed, we must first believe that we can. — Nikos Kazantzakis
83: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop. — Confucius
84: If you can dream it, you can do it. — Walt Disney
85: Do not be embarrassed by your failures, learn from them and start again. — Richard Branson
86: I failed my way to success. — Thomas Edison
87: Failure is another stepping stone to greatness. — Oprah Winfrey
88: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated. — Maya Angelou
89: Success is not the absence of failure; it's the persistence through failure. — Aisha Tyler
90: I never dreamed about success. I worked for it. — Estée Lauder
91: It always seems impossible until it's done. — Nelson Mandela
92: The secret of getting ahead is getting started. — Mark Twain
93: The only thing that overcomes hard luck is hard work. — Harry Golden
94: If you set your goals ridiculously high and it's a failure, you will fail above everyone else's success. — James Cameron
95: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it. — Henry David Thoreau
96: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going. — Sam Levenson
97: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams. — Eleanor Roosevelt
98: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm. — Winston Churchill
99: You just can't beat the person who never gives up. — Babe Ruth
100: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value. — Albert Einstein
101: Success is the sum of small efforts, repeated day-in and day-out. — Robert Collier
102: Don't be afraid to give up the good to go for the great. — John D. Rockefeller
103: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have. — Thomas Jefferson
